summary: Gambia Market is a local marketplace mobile app for The Gambia, designed to replace unorganized selling on WhatsApp/Facebook. The project has progressed from a blueprint/planning document phase to active development of the functional app. It allows users to buy and sell products and services locally with features including phone-number registration, location-based listings, in-app chat, mobile money payments, and a trust/safety system. Targeted at everyday Gambians, small business owners, market sellers, and youth entrepreneurs. The app prioritizes simple UI for low-end Android devices, low data usage, and fast loading on slow connections.
architectural_notes: Tech stack: React Native (Expo) with NativeWind for mobile, Node.js/Express backend, PostgreSQL plus Redis, Socket.io for chat, Cloudinary for image storage
Performance: Image compression to max 300kb, lazy loading, paginated API responses of 20 items, offline caching with WatermelonDB
MVP scope: Phone OTP, listing CRUD with 3 photos, regional feed, basic search, text-only chat, cash payments, report button, Android only
Development phase: Moving from blueprint/planning document to functional app with real listings, user accounts, search, chat, and payments
Auth: Replace Internet Identity with Apple ID and Google OAuth as the only login methods; JWT sessions must be cross-device compatible
known_issues: Message button on Listing Detail page is not functioning

existing_features.title: Create a visually rich, interactive single-page web application that presents the full Gambia Market product blueprint. The app should have a tabbed or sectioned navigation allowing users to browse: (1) Feature Breakdown, (2) User Flows, (3) Database Structure, (4) Tech Stack, (5) MVP Plan, (6) Future Features, (7) Monetization Strategy, and (8) Development Roadmap. Each section should be readable, well-organized, and easy to share.

Implement the Feature Breakdown section that lists and explains all core features of Gambia Market in a structured card or accordion layout: phone number registration with OTP, listing creation (photos, category, price, condition, location), home feed with nearby listings, search and filters (category, price, condition), in-app chat, verified seller badge system, delivery request and meet-up options, mobile money payments (Afrimoney, QMoney) and cash on delivery, and the trust/safety system (ratings, reviews, reports, block user). Include a brief description and icon for each feature.

Implement the User Flow section showing two clearly illustrated step-by-step journeys: the Buyer Journey (discover app → register with phone → browse/search listings → contact seller via chat → arrange delivery or meet-up → make payment → leave rating) and the Seller Journey (register → create listing with photos and details → receive buyer inquiry via chat → confirm delivery or meet-up → receive payment → build reputation via reviews). Use a visual stepper, timeline, or flowchart-style layout for each journey.

Implement the Database Structure section that displays the recommended data schema for Gambia Market. Show the following entities as styled table or card diagrams: Users (id, phone, name, location, verified_badge, rating, created_at), Listings (id, seller_id, title, description, category, price, condition, photos, location, status, is_boosted, created_at), Messages (id, listing_id, sender_id, receiver_id, content, timestamp), Transactions (id, listing_id, buyer_id, seller_id, payment_method, amount, status), Reviews (id, reviewer_id, reviewee_id, listing_id, stars, comment, created_at), Reports (id, reporter_id, reported_id, reason, status). Include field names, types, and brief descriptions.

Implement the Tech Stack section that presents the recommended technology choices for Gambia Market in a categorized layout. Categories: Frontend (React Native for cross-platform mobile), Backend (Node.js with Express or similar), Database (PostgreSQL or Firebase), Authentication (phone OTP via Africa's Talking or Twilio), Storage (Cloudinary for image uploads), Payments (Afrimoney API, QMoney API, cash on delivery flag), Hosting (affordable VPS or cloud), and Real-time Chat (Socket.io or Firebase Realtime DB). Each item should show the technology name, category, and a rationale sentence explaining why it fits low-data, low-end Android use in The Gambia.

Implement the MVP Plan section outlining the minimum viable product for a fast first launch. Display a prioritized feature checklist split into: Must Have (phone registration, listing creation, home feed, search/filters, in-app chat, basic trust/safety report) and Nice to Have for V1 (verified seller badge, delivery request, mobile money integration, star ratings). Include a suggested MVP timeline table showing weeks 1–8 with milestones (e.g., Week 1–2: Auth & Onboarding, Week 3–4: Listings, Week 5–6: Chat & Payments, Week 7–8: Testing & Launch).

Implement the Future Features section listing post-MVP advanced capabilities in a roadmap card layout. Include: AI-powered product recommendations, in-app escrow/payment protection, group buying deals, loyalty rewards program, seller analytics dashboard, delivery partner network integration, multi-language support (Wolof, Mandinka, Fula), voice search for low-literacy users, QR code listing sharing, and a web version for desktop access.

Implement the Monetization Strategy section explaining how Gambia Market can generate revenue. Display each revenue stream as a card with a title, description, and projected impact. Include: Boosted/Promoted Listings (sellers pay to appear at top of feed), Featured Seller Badge (monthly subscription for verified sellers), Transaction Fee (small percentage on completed mobile money transactions), Category Sponsorship (businesses pay to sponsor a category page), Premium Seller Tools (analytics, bulk listing, scheduling), and Partnership with Delivery Services (referral fees).

Implement the Development Roadmap section as a visual timeline showing 4 phases: Phase 1 – Foundation (months 1–2, MVP build), Phase 2 – Growth (months 3–4, marketing push and user acquisition across Gambian cities), Phase 3 – Monetization (months 5–6, introduce boosted listings, mobile money payments), Phase 4 – Scale & Advanced Features (months 7–12, delivery network, analytics, multilingual support). Each phase should list its key deliverables and success metrics.

Apply a warm, vibrant, African market-inspired visual theme across the entire app. Use a color palette inspired by West African textiles — warm greens, deep golds/amber, and earthy terracotta accents — on a clean off-white or light background. Typography should be bold and legible (sans-serif). Use subtle patterns or dividers inspired by kente or batik motifs as section separators. The overall feel should be energetic, trustworthy, and modern while remaining clearly local and culturally resonant. Apply this theme consistently to all navigation, cards, buttons, badges, and section headings.

Add a hero/banner section at the top of the app (above the navigation tabs) that introduces Gambia Market: show the app name, a tagline (e.g., 'Buy & Sell Locally in The Gambia — Simple, Safe, Fast'), and the target audience (everyday Gambians, small businesses, market sellers, youth entrepreneurs). Display the hero against the app's primary brand color with the generated hero banner image as background.

Store the blueprint content (feature list, user flow steps, DB schema entities, tech stack entries, MVP checklist, future features, monetization streams, roadmap phases) as structured static data in the frontend (e.g., TypeScript data files or constants). The UI components should render dynamically from this data so content is easy to update.

Implement a Phone Number Registration with OTP feature section: display a realistic UI mockup or detailed description card showing the registration flow — enter phone number, receive OTP via SMS, verify code, and complete profile setup. Include the step-by-step flow with form fields (phone input, OTP input, name, location) and validation states.

Implement a Listing Creation feature showcase card: display a detailed walkthrough of the listing creation flow including photo upload (multi-image), category selector, price input, condition selector (new/used/refurbished), and location tagging. Show this as an illustrated step-by-step card or mini-form mockup within the Feature Breakdown section.

Implement a Home Feed feature showcase: display a visual representation of the home feed showing nearby listings sorted by distance or region. Include a mock listing grid/list with sample listing cards (image, title, price, location badge, distance indicator) that illustrates the feed experience for Gambian users.

Implement a Search & Filters feature showcase: display an interactive-looking search bar mockup and filter panel showing category dropdown, price range slider/inputs, and condition checkboxes. Present this as a visual demo card within the Feature Breakdown section, illustrating how users would search and narrow down listings.

Implement an In-App Chat feature showcase: display a visual mockup of the real-time chat interface between buyer and seller, showing a conversation thread with message bubbles, listing context (thumbnail and title at top), timestamp display, and a message input bar. Include sample messages illustrating a buyer inquiry and seller response.

Implement a Verified Seller Badge feature showcase: display a detailed explanation card showing the badge verification process — ID upload step, review period, badge awarded state — alongside a visual example of a seller profile card showing the verified badge, star rating, and number of completed transactions.

Implement a Delivery & Meet-Up feature showcase: display a card illustrating the two fulfillment options — (1) Delivery Request with address input, estimated cost, and delivery partner selection, and (2) Meet-Up arrangement with proposed location and time. Show these as a side-by-side comparison card with icons and brief descriptions for each option.

Implement a Mobile Money Payments feature showcase: display a payment flow card showing the three payment methods — Afrimoney, QMoney, and Cash on Delivery. Include a mock payment selection screen with radio buttons or payment method cards, a confirmation step, and status badges (pending, completed). Show the Afrimoney and QMoney logos as styled text badges.

Implement a Trust & Safety System feature showcase: display a card illustrating the four trust mechanisms — (1) star ratings with a visual 5-star selector, (2) written review with sample text, (3) report system with a reason dropdown mockup, and (4) block user confirmation dialog. Present these as a 2×2 grid of mini-cards within the feature section.

Implement a Boosted & Promoted Listings feature showcase within the Monetization section: display a visual comparison card showing a standard listing versus a boosted listing (highlighted border, 'Sponsored' badge, top-of-feed position indicator). Include a pricing tier card showing boosting options (e.g., 3-day, 7-day, 30-day boost with example prices in GMD). Mark this as the primary revenue driver with a distinct highlight.

Redesign the App.tsx root component to transition from the blueprint SPA into a functional marketplace app with a proper page router supporting: Home Feed, Listings, Create Listing, Listing Detail, Chat, Profile, and Login pages. Replace the current tabbed blueprint navigation with a bottom navigation bar (mobile-first) and a top header with the Gambia Market logo, search icon, and profile icon.

Implement Internet Identity authentication so users can log in and create a session. On login, associate the user's principal with a user profile stored in the backend. Show a login prompt/page for unauthenticated users trying to access protected actions (create listing, chat, profile).

Build a Home Feed page that fetches all active listings from the backend and displays them as a responsive grid of listing cards. Each card shows: a photo (or category icon placeholder), title, price in GMD (Dalasi), location, condition badge, and a 'Boosted' badge for promoted listings. Include a category filter row at the top (All, Electronics, Clothing, Food, Vehicles, Services, etc.) and a search bar that filters listings by title.

Build a Listing Detail page that displays full information for a selected listing: all photos in a carousel, title, price, condition, description, seller info (name, verified badge, rating), location, and two action buttons — 'Message Seller' and 'Make Offer'. Navigating to this page from a listing card passes the listing ID and fetches details from the backend.

Build a Create Listing page (accessible via the 'Sell' tab) where authenticated users can create a new listing. The form must include: photo upload (up to 5 images stored as base64 or URLs), title input, category selector, price input (GMD), condition selector (New / Used / Refurbished), description textarea, and location input. On submit, call the backend createListing function and navigate to the new listing's detail page.

Build a Chat page that allows authenticated buyers and sellers to exchange messages about a listing. Display a list of active conversations in the Chat tab (each showing the other user's name, last message preview, and timestamp). Tapping a conversation opens a full message thread view with message bubbles (sent/received), the listing context shown at the top, and a text input bar to send new messages. Messages are stored in and retrieved from the backend.

Build a Profile page for authenticated users displaying their name, phone number (masked), location, verified badge status, average star rating, number of listings, and a list of their active listings. Include an Edit Profile button that opens an inline form to update name and location. Include a 'My Listings' section showing the user's own listings with options to edit or delete each listing.

Implement a Review & Ratings system. After a transaction is marked complete, allow the buyer to leave a star rating (1–5) and written review for the seller. Display aggregated star ratings and individual reviews on the seller's Profile page. Ratings and reviews are stored in the backend Reviews entity.

Implement a Report User feature accessible from any listing detail page or user profile. Display a 'Report' button that opens a modal with a dropdown of report reasons (Spam, Fraud, Inappropriate Content, Fake Listing, Other) and a submit button. On submit, call the backend createReport function and show a confirmation message.

Implement a Boosted Listings system. In the Create Listing or My Listings flow, allow sellers to boost a listing for a set duration (3-day, 7-day, 30-day) with prices shown in GMD. Toggling boost on a listing sets isBoosted to true in the backend. Boosted listings appear at the top of the Home Feed with a 'Sponsored' badge and a highlighted card border.

Create a React Query hooks file (frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts) with typed custom hooks for all backend interactions: useListings, useListing, useCreateListing, useUpdateListing, useDeleteListing, useUser, useUpdateUser, useMessages, useSendMessage, useCreateReview, useReviews, useCreateReport, and useBoostListing. All mutations should invalidate relevant query caches on success.

Fix the 'Message Seller' button on the Listing Detail page so that clicking it navigates the authenticated user to the Message Thread page for that listing and seller. If the user is not authenticated, show the login prompt instead. The button should pass the correct listingId and sellerId (receiverId) when opening or creating the conversation thread.

Simplify and streamline the Internet Identity login flow. Replace the current login prompt with a sleek, minimal one-tap login screen that shows the Gambia Market logo, a short benefit statement ('Buy & Sell Locally — Join in seconds'), and a single prominent 'Login with Internet Identity' button. Reduce the number of steps visible to the user, add a loading spinner with friendly copy ('Logging you in…'), and ensure the profile setup form (name, phone, location) is presented inline on the same screen after identity confirmation rather than as a separate page redirect. The flow should feel fast and frictionless.

Remove the authentication requirement for sending messages. Allow any user (authenticated or unauthenticated) to open a conversation thread and send messages about a listing. In the backend, add a public `sendMessageAnon` function that accepts a display name (or 'Guest') for unauthenticated senders alongside the message content, listingId, and receiverId, storing the message with a nullable senderId. Update the frontend MessageThread page and 'Message Seller' button to allow unauthenticated users to send messages by prompting for a display name once per session (stored in sessionStorage) rather than requiring a full login.

Make the Home Feed page more interactive. Add animated skeleton loaders while listings load, add a horizontal 'Featured' spotlight row at the top showcasing boosted listings as larger cards, add a pull-to-refresh gesture indicator (button on desktop), add subtle hover/press animations to listing cards (scale up, shadow lift), show an item count badge on the category filter (e.g., 'Electronics (12)'), and display a floating 'Sell Now' action button in the bottom-right corner for quick access to Create Listing.

Make the Search page more interactive. Convert the search experience into a dedicated full-screen search page (navigable from the Search tab) with an auto-focused search bar, live search results updating as the user types (debounced), recently searched terms stored in localStorage and shown as chips below the search bar, and animated filter toggles that slide open/closed. Show a 'No results' illustration with suggested categories when a search returns zero results.

Make the Chat page more interactive for all users. Show an unread message count badge on the Chat tab in the bottom navigation. In the conversation list, add a visual 'Online' indicator dot (based on recency — last active < 5 min). In the message thread view, add a typing indicator animation ('...') when a new message is being composed, smooth scroll-to-latest-message on new message arrival, and a 'Send' button that activates only when the input is non-empty. For unauthenticated users, show the conversation list as a blurred preview with an overlay CTA to log in to see full history.

Make the Profile page more interactive. Add a tabbed layout within the profile page with tabs: 'My Listings', 'Reviews', and 'Activity'. Show an animated avatar/initials circle with the user's name initial. Add a stats row with animated count-up numbers for total listings, average rating, and total reviews. Allow inline editing of name and location with a pencil icon that toggles the field into edit mode without opening a separate form. Show a 'Share Profile' button that copies a shareable profile link. For unauthenticated visitors viewing a public profile, show a 'Message This Seller' CTA prominently.

Implement a Like and Follow system for sellers. Users can 'Like' individual listings (heart icon on each listing card and detail page) and 'Follow' a seller from their PublicProfile or Listing Detail page. In the backend, add a `followSeller` function that records follower/following relationships (followerId → sellerId) and an `unfollowSeller` function to remove the relationship. Add a `likeListingAnon` / `likeListing` function to toggle a like on a listing, storing the liker's principal and the listing ID. Expose query functions `getFollowing`, `getFollowers`, and `getLikedListings`. In the Profile page, add a 'Following' tab showing followed sellers. Display follower counts on seller profiles and like counts on listing cards.

Allow users to upload and display a profile picture. Add a `profilePicUrl` field (Text, optional) to the UserProfile type in the backend. Add an `updateProfilePic` function that accepts a base64-encoded image string or URL and stores it on the caller's profile. On the Profile page and PublicProfile page, display the profile picture if available, or fall back to the animated initials avatar. Add a camera/upload icon button on the Profile page that opens a file picker to select a photo, converts it to base64, and calls `updateProfilePic`. Display the profile picture in the avatar circle of the BottomNav, AppHeader profile icon, SellerInfo component, and ConversationItem.

Ensure all user account data, sessions, and listed products are accessible from any device. Since the platform uses principal-based identity (Google/Apple), the same identity resolves to the same principal across devices, so data is inherently cross-device. Update the frontend to not rely on device-local state (localStorage/sessionStorage) for authenticated user data — all profile data, listings, conversations, and follows must be fetched from the backend on every session start. Add a `useGetCallerUserProfile` query that runs on app load for authenticated users to re-hydrate their profile from the backend rather than from local cache.

Ensure that all listed products persist in the backend indefinitely and are never automatically removed. Listings may only be deleted when the owner explicitly calls the `deleteListing` function from their own 'My Listings' section. Remove any TTL, expiry, or automatic cleanup logic from the backend if present. Inactive/sold listings should remain visible to the owner in their 'My Listings' tab with a status badge (Active / Sold / Paused) even after they are no longer shown in the public Home Feed.

new_feature_requests.summary: Phone number registration with OTP via SMS
Listing creation with photos, category, price, condition, and location tagging
Home feed with nearby listings sorted by distance or region
Search bar and category, price, and condition filters
In-app real-time chat between buyer and seller
Verified seller badge system with ID upload
Delivery request and meet-up arrangement options
Mobile money payments via Afrimoney and QMoney plus cash on delivery
Star ratings, written reviews, report system, and block user for trust and safety
Boosted and promoted listings as primary monetization feature

Implement a backend Motoko actor with a complete data model and CRUD operations for: Users (principal, phone, name, location, verifiedBadge, rating, createdAt), Listings (id, sellerId, title, description, category, price, condition, photos as blob/URL array, location, status, isBoosted, createdAt), Messages (id, listingId, senderId, receiverId, content, timestamp), Transactions (id, listingId, buyerId, sellerId, paymentMethod, amount, status), Reviews (id, reviewerId, revieweeId, listingId, stars, comment, createdAt), and Reports (id, reporterId, reportedId, reason, status). Replace the current minimal backend with this full schema.

Apply the existing West African-inspired visual theme (warm greens, deep golds/amber, terracotta accents, kente pattern dividers) consistently across all new functional pages and components: Home Feed, Listing Detail, Create Listing form, Chat, and Profile. Ensure mobile-first responsive layouts, large tap targets (min 44px), and readable font sizes suitable for low-end Android devices.
Simplify and streamline the login flow to be faster and more user-friendly
Allow all users (including unauthenticated) to message each other without barriers
Make Profile, Chat, Sell, Search, and Home pages more interactive and engaging for all users

Make the Sell (Create Listing) page more interactive and user-friendly. Add a live preview card on the right side (desktop) or as a collapsible preview panel (mobile) that updates in real time as the user fills in the form fields, showing exactly how the listing card will look in the feed. Add step progress indicators (Step 1 of 4: Photos → Details → Pricing → Review) to guide the user through the form. Show input validation feedback inline (green checkmark on valid, red error on invalid) as fields are completed. Add a 'Save Draft' option that persists form state to localStorage.
Redirect users to the main home page upon logout
Replace Internet Identity with Apple ID and Google login as the only authentication methods
Allow any logged-in user to view full seller info (name, phone, location, listings, reviews) when browsing
Sellers can share a unique shareable profile link to send to customers for easy discovery
Users can like and follow sellers to receive updates on new product listings
Users can upload a profile picture for identity and security purposes
User accounts and sessions are accessible across any device (cross-device login support)
Listed products persist indefinitely unless explicitly deleted by the owner from their account

After a user logs out from any page, immediately redirect them to the main Home Feed page. The logout action in Profile.tsx and any other location that calls the logout function must navigate to the home route after the identity session is cleared.

Replace the current Internet Identity authentication with Google and Apple ID as the only two supported login methods. Display both options as prominent buttons on the login screen. On successful authentication, associate the user's identity with a backend profile (creating one on first login). The existing LoginPrompt, ProfileSetup, and AuthGuard components must be updated to reflect the new providers. Internet Identity references should be removed from all UI-facing components.

Allow any logged-in user (regardless of role) to view the full seller profile when browsing — including the seller's display name, masked phone number, location, verified badge status, average star rating, listed products, and reviews. The seller info on the Listing Detail page and the PublicProfile page must show all these fields to any authenticated viewer. Unauthenticated visitors should see a prompt to log in to view full seller info.

Generate a unique shareable profile link for every seller. The link should use the seller's principal ID as a URL parameter (e.g., /public-profile?id=<principalId>). On the seller's Profile page and PublicProfile page, display a 'Share My Profile' button that copies this link to the clipboard and shows a confirmation toast. The link should be stable and accessible to anyone — even unauthenticated users can open it but will be prompted to log in to interact.
